alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 10:55PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Aitkin, southwestern Pine and southeastern Crow Wing Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1055 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Upper South Long Lake, to 7 miles east of Zimmerman, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Upper South Long Lake around 1100 PM CDT. Garrison around 1105 PM CDT. Crosby and Deerwood around 1115 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Aitkin and Rock Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin
